P.title: Will a major breakthrough in quantum computing be announced by 2025?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a major breakthrough in quantum computing is announced. A "major breakthrough" is defined as any development that significantly advances the field of quantum computing in terms of computational power, error rates, scalability, or practical applications. The breakthrough must be recognized as such by the scientific community, with confirmation through publication in a peer-reviewed scientific journal or presentation at a major scientific conference. In the absence of direct scientific publication, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) will be considered sufficient. Developments that only represent incremental improvements or are speculative in nature without empirical validation do not qualify.

Q_given_P.title: Given a major breakthrough in quantum computing is announced by 2025, will a significant political agreement be reached on international nuclear research collaboration by 2025?
Q_given_P.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a major breakthrough in quantum computing is announced. A "major breakthrough" is defined as any development that significantly advances the field of quantum computing in terms of computational power, error rates, scalability, or practical applications. The breakthrough must be recognized as such by the scientific community, with confirmation through publication in a peer-reviewed scientific journal or presentation at a major scientific conference. In the absence of direct scientific publication, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) will be considered sufficient. Developments that only represent incremental improvements or are speculative in nature without empirical validation do not qualify.

This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a significant political agreement on international nuclear research collaboration is officially announced. A "significant political agreement" is defined as an agreement that involves at least three countries and includes commitments to joint research projects, funding, and sharing of nuclear technologies for peaceful purposes. The agreement must be formalized through an official treaty, memorandum of understanding, or a similar legally binding document. The countries involved must include at least one of the following: United States, Russia, China, France, or the United Kingdom. Verification of the agreement will be based on official government announcements or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. In the event of an agreement that is announced but not implemented by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

R_given_P_and_Q.title: Given a major breakthrough in quantum computing and a significant political agreement on international nuclear research collaboration by 2025, will the United States lead the world in quantum computing technology development by 2030?
R_given_P_and_Q.body:
Suppose the following is true: By December 31, 2025, both of the following occur: (a) a major breakthrough in quantum computing is announced, and (b) a significant political agreement on international nuclear research collaboration is officially announced.

A "major breakthrough" in quantum computing is defined as any development that significantly advances the field of quantum computing in terms of computational power, error rates, scalability, or practical applications. The breakthrough must be recognized as such by the scientific community, with confirmation through publication in a peer-reviewed scientific journal or presentation at a major scientific conference. In the absence of direct scientific publication, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) will be considered sufficient. Developments that only represent incremental improvements or are speculative in nature without empirical validation do not qualify.

A "significant political agreement" on international nuclear research collaboration is defined as an agreement that involves at least three countries and includes commitments to joint research projects, funding, and sharing of nuclear technologies for peaceful purposes. The agreement must be formalized through an official treaty, memorandum of understanding, or a similar legally binding document. The countries involved must include at least one of the following: United States, Russia, China, France, or the United Kingdom. Verification of the agreement will be based on official government announcements or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. In the event of an agreement that is announced but not implemented by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

Then, will the United States lead the world in quantum computing technology development by 2030?

This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the United States is recognized as the global leader in the development of quantum computing technology. Leadership will be determined based on the following criteria:

- Number of quantum computers developed that surpass the capabilities of existing classical computers in significant computational tasks (quantum supremacy).
- Volume and impact of peer-reviewed scientific publications originating from the United States that contribute to quantum computing technology.
- Investment in quantum computing research and development by both the public and private sectors in the United States, compared to other countries.

Global leadership must be recognized by at least two of the following authoritative sources: the International Quantum Computing Association, the IEEE Quantum Computing Task Force, or significant coverage in at least three major technology or science news outlets (e.g., Wired, MIT Technology Review, Nature).

In the event of a dispute over leadership, the consensus among these sources will be considered definitive.

P_and_Q_and_R.title: Will both a major breakthrough in quantum computing and a significant political agreement on international nuclear research collaboration be announced by 2025, and will the United States lead the world in quantum computing technology development by 2030?
P_and_Q_and_R.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if all of the following occur: (1) By December 31, 2025, both of the following occur: (a) a major breakthrough in quantum computing is announced, and (b) a significant political agreement on international nuclear research collaboration is officially announced. (2) By December 31, 2030, the United States is recognized as the global leader in the development of quantum computing technology.

A "major breakthrough" in quantum computing is defined as any development that significantly advances the field of quantum computing in terms of computational power, error rates, scalability, or practical applications. The breakthrough must be recognized as such by the scientific community, with confirmation through publication in a peer-reviewed scientific journal or presentation at a major scientific conference. In the absence of direct scientific publication, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) will be considered sufficient. Developments that only represent incremental improvements or are speculative in nature without empirical validation do not qualify.

A "significant political agreement" on international nuclear research collaboration is defined as an agreement that involves at least three countries and includes commitments to joint research projects, funding, and sharing of nuclear technologies for peaceful purposes. The agreement must be formalized through an official treaty, memorandum of understanding, or a similar legally binding document. The countries involved must include at least one of the following: United States, Russia, China, France, or the United Kingdom. Verification of the agreement will be based on official government announcements or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. In the event of an agreement that is announced but not implemented by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

Global leadership in quantum computing technology by the United States will be determined based on the following criteria:

- Number of quantum computers developed that surpass the capabilities of existing classical computers in significant computational tasks (quantum supremacy).
- Volume and impact of peer-reviewed scientific publications originating from the United States that contribute to quantum computing technology.
- Investment in quantum computing research and development by both the public and private sectors in the United States, compared to other countries.

Global leadership must be recognized by at least two of the following authoritative sources: the International Quantum Computing Association, the IEEE Quantum Computing Task Force, or significant coverage in at least three major technology or science news outlets (e.g., Wired, MIT Technology Review, Nature).

In the event of a dispute over leadership, the consensus among these sources will be considered definitive.

R.title: Will the United States lead the world in quantum computing technology development by 2030?
R.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the United States is recognized as the global leader in the development of quantum computing technology. Leadership will be determined based on the following criteria:

- Number of quantum computers developed that surpass the capabilities of existing classical computers in significant computational tasks (quantum supremacy).
- Volume and impact of peer-reviewed scientific publications originating from the United States that contribute to quantum computing technology.
- Investment in quantum computing research and development by both the public and private sectors in the United States, compared to other countries.

Global leadership must be recognized by at least two of the following authoritative sources: the International Quantum Computing Association, the IEEE Quantum Computing Task Force, or significant coverage in at least three major technology or science news outlets (e.g., Wired, MIT Technology Review, Nature).

In the event of a dispute over leadership, the consensus among these sources will be considered definitive.

reasons: A major breakthrough in quantum computing could influence international political agreements on nuclear research collaboration, as advancements in quantum computing could enhance nuclear research capabilities and security measures.

The United States leading in quantum computing technology development by 2030 could be influenced by both the breakthrough in quantum computing and the international political agreements on nuclear research collaboration, as these factors could affect funding, research priorities, and international cooperation.
relevance.conclusion: The logical combination of these questions is relevant because advancements in quantum computing and international political agreements on nuclear research collaboration could be interrelated and influence the United States' leadership in quantum computing technology.

P.title: Will the United States become the world's largest producer of renewable energy by 2030?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the United States is officially recognized as the world's largest producer of renewable energy, measured by total megawatts (MW) of renewable energy capacity installed or by total renewable energy generated in a year. Renewable energy includes solar, wind, hydroelectric, geothermal, and biomass energy sources. The assessment will be based on data and reports from authoritative sources such as the International Energy Agency (IEA), the U.S. Energy Information Administration (EIA), or equivalent. In the event of discrepancies between sources, the source with the most comprehensive and recent data will be considered authoritative. The resolution will consider only operational capacity, excluding projects under construction or in planning stages. In case of a tie or near-tie (within a 1% margin), the question will resolve as No, requiring clear leadership in renewable energy production.

Q_given_P.title: Given the United States becomes the world's largest producer of renewable energy by 2030, will Microsoft's carbon negative pledge significantly impact global CO2 levels by 2030?
Q_given_P.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the United States is officially recognized as the world's largest producer of renewable energy, measured by total megawatts (MW) of renewable energy capacity installed or by total renewable energy generated in a year. Renewable energy includes solar, wind, hydroelectric, geothermal, and biomass energy sources. The assessment will be based on data and reports from authoritative sources such as the International Energy Agency (IEA), the U.S. Energy Information Administration (EIA), or equivalent. In the event of discrepancies between sources, the source with the most comprehensive and recent data will be considered authoritative. The resolution will consider only operational capacity, excluding projects under construction or in planning stages. In case of a tie or near-tie (within a 1% margin), the question will resolve as No, requiring clear leadership in renewable energy production.

Additionally, this question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, Microsoft's carbon negative pledge has resulted in a measurable and significant reduction in global CO2 levels. A "significant reduction" is defined as a decrease in global CO2 levels by at least 0.1% from 2020 levels, attributable directly to Microsoft's initiatives. This includes, but is not limited to, direct carbon capture and storage efforts, renewable energy investments, and ecosystem restoration projects. The assessment must be confirmed by data from authoritative sources such as the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC) or the International Energy Agency (IEA). In the absence of direct attribution to Microsoft's efforts, a consensus among at least three reputable scientific publications or environmental organizations is required. The resolution will consider only actions taken by Microsoft up to December 31, 2030, and their impact on CO2 levels by that date. Temporary or reversible actions do not count towards this question's resolution.

R_given_P_and_Q.title: Given the US becomes the largest producer of renewable energy and Microsoft's carbon negative pledge significantly impacts global CO2 levels by 2030, will the US House of Representatives pass a significant bill regarding foreign policy towards Iran before 2025?
R_given_P_and_Q.body:
Suppose the following is true: By December 31, 2030, (a) the United States is officially recognized as the world's largest producer of renewable energy, measured by total megawatts (MW) of renewable energy capacity installed or by total renewable energy generated in a year. Renewable energy includes solar, wind, hydroelectric, geothermal, and biomass energy sources. The assessment will be based on data and reports from authoritative sources such as the International Energy Agency (IEA), the U.S. Energy Information Administration (EIA), or equivalent. In the event of discrepancies between sources, the source with the most comprehensive and recent data will be considered authoritative. The resolution will consider only operational capacity, excluding projects under construction or in planning stages. In case of a tie or near-tie (within a 1% margin), the question will resolve as No, requiring clear leadership in renewable energy production. (b) Microsoft's carbon negative pledge has resulted in a measurable and significant reduction in global CO2 levels. A "significant reduction" is defined as a decrease in global CO2 levels by at least 0.1% from 2020 levels, attributable directly to Microsoft's initiatives. This includes, but is not limited to, direct carbon capture and storage efforts, renewable energy investments, and ecosystem restoration projects. The assessment must be confirmed by data from authoritative sources such as the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC) or the International Energy Agency (IEA). In the absence of direct attribution to Microsoft's efforts, a consensus among at least three reputable scientific publications or environmental organizations is required. The resolution will consider only actions taken by Microsoft up to December 31, 2030, and their impact on CO2 levels by that date. Temporary or reversible actions do not count towards this question's resolution.

Then is the following true: Before January 1, 2025, the US House of Representatives passes a bill that significantly alters the United States' foreign policy towards Iran. A bill will be considered significant if it involves substantial changes in trade, military, diplomatic relations, or sanctions. The passage of the bill must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The New York Times, Reuters, The Washington Post) are sufficient. The bill must be passed by the House of Representatives and not merely proposed or discussed. In the event of a veto by the President, the question will resolve as Yes only if the veto is overridden.

R.title: Will the US House of Representatives pass a significant bill regarding foreign policy towards Iran before 2025?
R.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2025, the US House of Representatives passes a bill that significantly alters the United States' foreign policy towards Iran. A bill will be considered significant if it involves substantial changes in trade, military, diplomatic relations, or sanctions. The passage of the bill must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The New York Times, Reuters, The Washington Post) are sufficient. The bill must be passed by the House of Representatives and not merely proposed or discussed. In the event of a veto by the President, the question will resolve as Yes only if the veto is overridden.

reasons: The United States becoming the world's largest producer of renewable energy by 2030 could influence global energy markets and international relations, potentially affecting foreign policy decisions, including those towards Iran.

Microsoft's carbon negative pledge, if successful, could set a precedent for other major corporations and influence global environmental policies, which might intersect with international relations and foreign policy, including those towards countries like Iran.
A significant bill regarding foreign policy towards Iran could impact international cooperation on environmental issues, including renewable energy and carbon reduction initiatives.
relevance.conclusion: There are plausible reasons to consider the logical combination of these questions, as they all touch on significant global issues that could be interrelated through international policy and environmental impact.

P.title: Will a major epidemic influence the outcome of a national election in any country before 2030?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, a major epidemic significantly influences the outcome of a national election in any country. A "major epidemic" is defined as an outbreak of disease that results in significant morbidity or mortality, receives widespread national or international media coverage, and is officially declared an epidemic by the World Health Organization (WHO) or the national health authority of the country in question. The influence on the election outcome must be clearly attributable to the epidemic, such as through a significant shift in public opinion, voter turnout, or the implementation of election-related policies (e.g., mail-in voting, election postponement). The determination of significant influence will be based on analysis from at least three reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) or academic publications. In the event of multiple epidemics influencing elections in different countries, the question will resolve as Yes upon the first verified instance.

Q_given_P.title: Conditional on a major epidemic influencing the outcome of a national election in any country before 2030, will China lead the world in quantum computing research by 2030?
Q_given_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before January 1, 2030, a major epidemic significantly influences the outcome of a national election in any country. A "major epidemic" is defined as an outbreak of disease that results in significant morbidity or mortality, receives widespread national or international media coverage, and is officially declared an epidemic by the World Health Organization (WHO) or the national health authority of the country in question. The influence on the election outcome must be clearly attributable to the epidemic, such as through a significant shift in public opinion, voter turnout, or the implementation of election-related policies (e.g., mail-in voting, election postponement). The determination of significant influence will be based on analysis from at least three reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) or academic publications. In the event of multiple epidemics influencing elections in different countries, the question will resolve as Yes upon the first verified instance.

Then, will China lead the world in quantum computing research by December 31, 2030? Leadership in quantum computing research is defined by the following criteria:

- Publication Volume: China must have the highest number of peer-reviewed scientific publications in the field of quantum computing, compared to any other country.
- Citation Impact: Chinese publications in quantum computing must have the highest citation impact, indicating significant influence on the field.
- Technological Breakthroughs: China must have achieved at least one major technological breakthrough in quantum computing that is recognized by the international scientific community.

Recognition of China's leadership position must be confirmed by at least two of the following authoritative sources: Nature, Science, IEEE Spectrum, or the annual reports of the National Quantum Initiative or the European Quantum Flagship program.

In the event of a tie in any of the criteria above, additional factors such as international awards in quantum computing, or leadership in international quantum computing collaborations, may be considered.

R_given_P_and_Q.title: Given a major epidemic influences a national election and China leads in quantum computing by 2030, will a significant political agreement on international nuclear research collaboration be reached by 2025?
R_given_P_and_Q.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a significant political agreement on international nuclear research collaboration is officially announced. A "significant political agreement" is defined as an agreement that involves at least three countries and includes commitments to joint research projects, funding, and sharing of nuclear technologies for peaceful purposes. The agreement must be formalized through an official treaty, memorandum of understanding, or a similar legally binding document. Verification of the agreement will be based on official government announcements or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. In the event of an agreement that is announced but not implemented by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

For the condition to be met, both of the following must occur before January 1, 2030:

(a) A major epidemic significantly influences the outcome of a national election in any country. A "major epidemic" is defined as an outbreak of disease that results in significant morbidity or mortality, receives widespread national or international media coverage, and is officially declared an epidemic by the World Health Organization (WHO) or the national health authority of the country in question. The influence on the election outcome must be clearly attributable to the epidemic, such as through a significant shift in public opinion, voter turnout, or the implementation of election-related policies (e.g., mail-in voting, election postponement). The determination of significant influence will be based on analysis from at least three reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) or academic publications. In the event of multiple epidemics influencing elections in different countries, the question will resolve as Yes upon the first verified instance.

(b) China is recognized as the global leader in quantum computing research. Leadership in quantum computing research is defined by the following criteria:

- Publication Volume: China must have the highest number of peer-reviewed scientific publications in the field of quantum computing, compared to any other country.
- Citation Impact: Chinese publications in quantum computing must have the highest citation impact, indicating significant influence on the field.
- Technological Breakthroughs: China must have achieved at least one major technological breakthrough in quantum computing that is recognized by the international scientific community.

Recognition of China's leadership position must be confirmed by at least two of the following authoritative sources: Nature, Science, IEEE Spectrum, or the annual reports of the National Quantum Initiative or the European Quantum Flagship program.

In the event of a tie in any of the criteria above, additional factors such as international awards in quantum computing, or leadership in international quantum computing collaborations, may be considered.

reasons: A major epidemic could influence global political stability and international relations, which might indirectly affect international collaborations, including those in nuclear research.
China's leadership in quantum computing could influence its geopolitical power and its role in international agreements, including those related to nuclear research.
A significant political agreement on international nuclear research collaboration could be influenced by global health crises and technological advancements, including quantum computing.
relevance.conclusion: There are plausible reasons to consider the logical combination of these questions, as they all involve significant global events and technological advancements that could influence each other.

P.title: Will a major social sciences study reveal the impact of engineering advancements on societal structures by 2030?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a major study in the social sciences is published that reveals significant findings on the impact of engineering advancements (such as artificial intelligence, robotics, green energy technologies, or infrastructure development) on societal structures. The study must be conducted by a reputable academic institution or research organization and must be published in a peer-reviewed journal recognized in the field of social sciences. The findings should address changes in at least one of the following areas: employment, social inequality, urban development, or family dynamics. The study must be cited by at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) or recognized by a leading academic body in the social sciences as a significant contribution to the field. In the event that multiple studies meet these criteria, the question will resolve as Yes upon the publication of the first study that meets all the specified conditions.

Q_given_P.title: Given a major social sciences study reveals the impact of engineering advancements on societal structures by 2030, will a major geopolitical event significantly impact global health security by 2025?
Q_given_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: By December 31, 2030, a major study in the social sciences is published that reveals significant findings on the impact of engineering advancements (such as artificial intelligence, robotics, green energy technologies, or infrastructure development) on societal structures. The study must be conducted by a reputable academic institution or research organization and must be published in a peer-reviewed journal recognized in the field of social sciences. The findings should address changes in at least one of the following areas: employment, social inequality, urban development, or family dynamics. The study must be cited by at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) or recognized by a leading academic body in the social sciences as a significant contribution to the field. In the event that multiple studies meet these criteria, the question will resolve as Yes upon the publication of the first study that meets all the specified conditions.

Then, will a major geopolitical event significantly impact global health security by 2025? This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a major geopolitical event has significantly impacted global health security. A "major geopolitical event" is defined as an event that involves the military, political, or economic actions of one or more countries that have a widespread impact on global stability or international relations. The impact on "global health security" must be significant, affecting international health regulations, causing widespread health crises (e.g., pandemics, significant increases in mortality rates, or major disruptions to healthcare systems), or leading to substantial changes in global health policy. The event and its impact on global health security must be confirmed by at least three reputable news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) or official statements from international health organizations (WHO, CDC). In the absence of direct evidence, a consensus among experts in international relations and global health, as reported by the aforementioned sources, will be considered sufficient. The resolution will consider the direct and immediate effects of the geopolitical event, not long-term consequences that unfold over years.

R_given_P_and_Q.title: Conditional on both a major social sciences study revealing the impact of engineering advancements on societal structures by 2030 and a major geopolitical event significantly impacting global health security by 2025, will the value of Bitcoin exceed the US dollar in terms of global transaction volume by 2030?
R_given_P_and_Q.body: Suppose the following is true: (a) By December 31, 2030, a major study in the social sciences is published that reveals significant findings on the impact of engineering advancements (such as artificial intelligence, robotics, green energy technologies, or infrastructure development) on societal structures. The study must be conducted by a reputable academic institution or research organization and must be published in a peer-reviewed journal recognized in the field of social sciences. The findings should address changes in at least one of the following areas: employment, social inequality, urban development, or family dynamics. The study must be cited by at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) or recognized by a leading academic body in the social sciences as a significant contribution to the field. In the event that multiple studies meet these criteria, the question will resolve as Yes upon the publication of the first study that meets all the specified conditions. (b) By December 31, 2025, a major geopolitical event has significantly impacted global health security. A "major geopolitical event" is defined as an event that involves the military, political, or economic actions of one or more countries that have a widespread impact on global stability or international relations. The impact on "global health security" must be significant, affecting international health regulations, causing widespread health crises (e.g., pandemics, significant increases in mortality rates, or major disruptions to healthcare systems), or leading to substantial changes in global health policy. The event and its impact on global health security must be confirmed by at least three reputable news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) or official statements from international health organizations (WHO, CDC). In the absence of direct evidence, a consensus among experts in international relations and global health, as reported by the aforementioned sources, will be considered sufficient. The resolution will consider the direct and immediate effects of the geopolitical event, not long-term consequences that unfold over years. Then is the following true: By December 31, 2030, the total global transaction volume of Bitcoin exceeds that of the US dollar within a single calendar year. Transaction volume refers to the total value of all transactions processed over a given time period. This includes but is not limited to purchases, sales, and transfers. The assessment will be based on data reported by authoritative financial institutions or organizations specializing in tracking cryptocurrency and fiat currency transactions, such as the International Monetary Fund (IMF), World Bank, major central banks, or recognized financial market analysis firms. In the absence of direct data, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) will be considered sufficient. The resolution will consider adjustments for inflation and currency valuation changes over the period. In the event of a close call, where the transaction volumes are within a margin of error of 5% or less, the question will resolve as No.

R.title: Will the value of Bitcoin exceed the US dollar in terms of global transaction volume by 2030?
R.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the total global transaction volume of Bitcoin exceeds that of the US dollar within a single calendar year. Transaction volume refers to the total value of all transactions processed over a given time period. This includes but is not limited to purchases, sales, and transfers. The assessment will be based on data reported by authoritative financial institutions or organizations specializing in tracking cryptocurrency and fiat currency transactions, such as the International Monetary Fund (IMF), World Bank, major central banks, or recognized financial market analysis firms. In the absence of direct data, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) will be considered sufficient. The resolution will consider adjustments for inflation and currency valuation changes over the period. In the event of a close call, where the transaction volumes are within a margin of error of 5% or less, the question will resolve as No.

reasons: The first question involves the impact of engineering advancements on societal structures, which could be influenced by major geopolitical events. For example, geopolitical stability or instability can affect the pace and focus of engineering advancements and their societal impacts.

The second question involves a major geopolitical event impacting global health security. Geopolitical events can also influence engineering advancements, especially in areas like healthcare technology, which could be part of the social sciences study mentioned in the first question.

The third question involves the value of Bitcoin in global transaction volume. While this seems less directly related to the other two questions, geopolitical events can influence economic stability and the adoption of alternative currencies like Bitcoin. Additionally, engineering advancements in financial technology could impact Bitcoin's transaction volume.
relevance.conclusion: There are plausible connections between the questions, particularly through the lens of geopolitical events influencing both societal structures and economic systems, including the adoption of Bitcoin.

P.title: Will the US Congress pass a major electoral reform bill before 2030?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, the US Congress passes a major electoral reform bill. A "major electoral reform bill" is defined as legislation that includes significant changes to at least two of the following areas: voting methods, redistricting processes, campaign finance regulations, or voter registration processes. The bill must be signed into law by the President of the United States. For the purposes of this question, "significant changes" are those that alter the legal framework in a way that could reasonably be expected to have a substantial impact on electoral outcomes or voter participation. The passage of the bill must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters) are sufficient. In the event of a partial implementation of the bill's provisions (e.g., if certain sections are not enacted or are delayed), the question will resolve as Yes only if the implemented sections include significant changes to at least two of the areas mentioned above.

Q_given_P.title: Conditional on the US Congress passing a major electoral reform bill before 2030, will Microsoft engage in a significant geopolitical initiative by 2025?
Q_given_P.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, Microsoft has officially announced or is actively participating in a significant geopolitical initiative. A "significant geopolitical initiative" is defined as an effort or project that has a substantial impact on international relations, global policies, or geopolitical landscapes, and involves collaboration or engagement with one or more national governments, international organizations, or significant non-state actors. The initiative must be aimed at addressing major global challenges such as climate change, cybersecurity, digital privacy, international trade, or global health crises. Confirmation must come from official Microsoft announcements or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. In the event of ambiguity or disputed claims, the resolution will defer to the consensus of reputable news sources.

In the event of a partial implementation of the bill's provisions (e.g., if certain sections are not enacted or are delayed), the question will resolve as Yes only if the implemented sections include significant changes to at least two of the areas mentioned above.

R_given_P_and_Q.title: Conditional on both a major electoral reform bill passing in the US before 2030 and Microsoft engaging in a significant geopolitical initiative by 2025, will a major technological breakthrough in AI be influenced by philosophical theories by 2030?
R_given_P_and_Q.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a major technological breakthrough in artificial intelligence (AI) is officially recognized and can be directly attributed to the influence of philosophical theories. A "major technological breakthrough" is defined as a development that significantly advances the field of AI in terms of capabilities, efficiency, or understanding, and is recognized as such by a consensus of experts in the field or a leading AI research institution. The influence of philosophical theories must be explicitly acknowledged in the official announcement of the breakthrough, or in the primary scientific literature describing the breakthrough (e.g., peer-reviewed journal articles, conference papers). The acknowledgment must specify how philosophical theories influenced the breakthrough, whether in the design, conceptual framework, or implementation of the AI technology. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient to confirm the breakthrough and its philosophical influence. If multiple breakthroughs meet these criteria, the question will resolve as Yes upon the first such confirmation.

For the condition to be met, both of the following must occur: (a) the US Congress passes a major electoral reform bill before January 1, 2030, and (b) Microsoft engages in a significant geopolitical initiative by December 31, 2025.

For part (a), a "major electoral reform bill" is defined as legislation that includes significant changes to at least two of the following areas: voting methods, redistricting processes, campaign finance regulations, or voter registration processes. The bill must be signed into law by the President of the United States. For the purposes of this question, "significant changes" are those that alter the legal framework in a way that could reasonably be expected to have a substantial impact on electoral outcomes or voter participation. The passage of the bill must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters) are sufficient. In the event of a partial implementation of the bill's provisions (e.g., if certain sections are not enacted or are delayed), the question will resolve as Yes only if the implemented sections include significant changes to at least two of the areas mentioned above.

For part (b), a "significant geopolitical initiative" is defined as an effort or project that has a substantial impact on international relations, global policies, or geopolitical landscapes, and involves collaboration or engagement with one or more national governments, international organizations, or significant non-state actors. The initiative must be aimed at addressing major global challenges such as climate change, cybersecurity, digital privacy, international trade, or global health crises. Confirmation must come from official Microsoft announcements or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. In the event of ambiguity or disputed claims, the resolution will defer to the consensus of reputable news sources.

If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.
